meanings.definition: To fill with wonder or astonishment
meanings.sent1: The magician amazes the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: Her talent for painting amazes everyone who sees her work.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog amazes the children at the park.
meanings.sent4: The speed of the cheetah amazes us, like a lightning bolt in the savannah.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset amazes me every evening.

meanings.sent1: The complex puzzle amazes me; I can't figure it out.
meanings.sent2: The maze in the garden amazes visitors as they try to find their way out.
meanings.sent3: The strange behavior of the cat amazes the vet during the check-up.
meanings.sent4: The twists and turns of the mystery novel amaze the readers.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist amazes the audience, leaving them in suspense.

meanings.definition: To cause great surprise or admiration
meanings.sent1: The sudden appearance of the rainbow amazes the children playing outside.
meanings.sent2: His generosity amazes me; he always helps those in need.
meanings.sent3: The size of the whale amazes the tourists on the boat.
meanings.sent4: The resilience of the human spirit amazes me, like a phoenix rising from the ashes.
meanings.sent5: The skill of the acrobat amazes the crowd, as they watch in awe.
